org.digidoc4j

Class DataFile

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.digidoc4j.DataFile
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class DataFile
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Data file wrapper providing methods for handling signed files or files to be signed in Container.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • calculateDigest

        public byte[] calculateDigest()
                       throws java.lang.Exception
        Calculates digest http://www.w3.org/2001/04/xmlenc#sha256 for the data file. If the digest has already been calculated it will return it, otherwise it calculates the digest.

        Returns:
        calculated digest
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - thrown if the file does not exist or the digest calculation fails.

      • calculateDigest

        public byte[] calculateDigest(java.net.URL method)
        Calculates digest for data file. If digest is already calculated returns it, otherwise calculates the digest.

        Supported uris for BDoc:


        http://www.w3.org/2000/09/xmldsig#sha1
        http://www.w3.org/2001/04/xmldsig-more#sha224
        http://www.w3.org/2001/04/xmlenc#sha256
        http://www.w3.org/2001/04/xmldsig-more#sha384
        http://www.w3.org/2001/04/xmlenc#sha512

        In case of DDoc files the parameter is ignored and SHA1 hash is always returned

        Parameters:
        method - method uri for calculating the digest
        Returns:
        calculated digest

      • calculateDigest

        public byte[] calculateDigest(DigestAlgorithm digestType)
        Parameters:
        digestType - digest algorithm type
        Returns:
        digest algorithm uri

      • saveAs

        public void saveAs(java.io.OutputStream out)

        Saves a copy of the data file as a file to the specified stream.
        Parameters:

        Throws:

      • saveAs

        public void saveAs(java.lang.String path)
        Saves a copy of the data file as a file with the specified file name.
        Parameters:
        path - full file path where the data file should be saved to. If the file exists it will be overwritten
